caption: A relatively modest grave set amongst the spectacular tombs of so many others but clearly marked with photographs, objects, a protective fence and a tree wrapped in bubblegum.  People keep moving the pin on Maps to the wrong side of the path and uploading images of completely different things which can cause some confusion but plan carefully with the correct details and site map and it's easy to find.  The cemetery closed at 6pm.when we were there and all visitors are ushered out to the sounds of ringing bells, check the opening times before you go as there's so many amazing things to see here.
Such a beautiful and tranquil place pere la chaise cemetery.  Could spend the whole day there looking around.

I came to find you my teenage friend... Without my long hair, without the careless look in my eyes. But even now, it's not too late... Besides, not much has changed. The days are still strange and even stranger the  people are...

Once in a lifetime trip to see his final resting place. My hotel was 20mins away so it was now or never. I must admit that the graveyard needs a month to explore, I've seen a few, but this is the size of a small town! Back to his grave, small un assuming, fenced off but you can see his grave. A very nice adventure to pay my respects.

"No eternal reward will forgive us now for wasting the dawn..."  Simply the best attraction in Paris. Definitely worth the pilgrimage.  If you want even a remote chance of spending a quiet 5 minutes by yourself, in the presence of the Lizard King himself, in such picturesque surroundings, I would humbly suggest you get to the cemetery as it opens at 8am, then make your way briskly to his tomb.
Visited a number of times and it is simply beautiful. Visiting on a major anniversary sees a good turnout and a special atmosphere. 2011 saw a visit from Ray and Robbie. Emotional stuff.

One of the highlights of my life. Finding the grave is part of the journey (do your research before you go!) A really special experience in a beautiful (and a little somber of course) location. The history held there is just amazing.

This is the tombe of Jim Morrison, lead singer of the Doors. It probably is still the most popular tomb on P√®re Lachaise.  There are gates to prevent fans to get too near the grave. The grave and the tombstone have been damaged before. This is not the original tombstone.

One of the greatest Artist! Buts not nice the fence. Also the people looks disabled, when "THE END" is playing respectfully....  they are THINKING, NOT POSSIBLE AT A SIGHTSEEINGPOINT! ! ! THEY DON'T HAVE A CLUE/PLAN WHO THIS MAN WAS! ! ! Stupid TOURISTS!
I had to visit the Lizard King while in Paris. Cimeti√®re du P√®re Lachaise is one of the most beautiful cemeteries I've ever walked through.
The cemetery is worth going to but they have a fence around Jim Morrison tomb and I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth the trip. A walk in the cemetery is though, certainly a beautiful gothic cemetery
A beautiful seemingly endless experience walking thru here
If you're a Doors fan it's a must see. Above that the cemetery its self is amazing!
One and best!! It was an honor!! What a pity that we couldn't enter inside of the borders to see the grave better.. But it was a life goal to go there!!

Coming from Canada, with only part of one day to visit, we took a taxi for 45 min.  We arrived 15 mins before closing time only to be told that the cemetery was closed at 5:45(not the posted 6 pm) and we were not allowed entry. Although I pleaded for 5 mins to simply take one photo, the female guard closed the door in my face.
Sixteen year old me is raging at sixty-two year old me that it took so long to come here. Sixty-two year old me is giving a small gallic shrug.

It was with great honor to be able to visit the Doors frontman, Jim Morrison's grave. Always sad when a master of the arts is lost. R.I.P. Jim. "Death makes angels of us all and gives us wings where we had shoulders smooth as ravens claws." - Jim Morrison.
We wanted to visit Jim Morrison‚Äòs tomb only and were very positively surprised by beauty and atmosphere of cimeti√®re p√®re lachaise.
Not a huge Doors fan but could totally feel Jim‚Äôs spirit walking with me for a min or two as if thanking me for visiting and letting me know that everything is all right!

Morrison died on July 3, 1971 at age 27 . Morrison is buried in P√®re Lachaise Cemetery in Paris, one of the city's most visited tourist attractions. James Douglas "Jim" Morrison (December 8, 1943 ‚Äì July 3, 1971) was an American singer-songwriter and poet, best remembered as the lead singer rock band The Doors. From a young age, Morrison developed an alcohol dependency which led to his death at the age of 27 in Paris. He is alleged to have died of a heroin overdose, but as no autopsy was performed, the exact cause of his death is still disputed. The Greek phrase "ŒöŒëŒ§Œë Œ§ŒüŒù ŒîŒëŒôŒúŒüŒùŒë ŒïŒëŒ•Œ§ŒüŒ•" may be translated in several ways, including as "do what thou wilt" or " true to your own spirit"
For me it's to moving I cry wen i was there joust for Jim or my problams well I dont know i know i cry and if i cry its the filing and the connection RIP Jim I will there with you one day good bless
nice üëçüèæ ‚Ä¶

The Necropolis is great. The tomb is not that fancy for non-fan. It is in P√®re Lachaise Cemetery. In addition to Jim Morrisons's grave, you can appreciate tombstone of other important people and its arts. The park can be good place for recreation. There is a viewpoint on the hill too. the temperature here can be chill.

It's really hard to find but once you are getting close you can just follow the crowd of fans trying to pay a visit to Jim Morrison. Do not expect the grave to be in great conditions as many fans have ruined it in different ways. Again, as many things in Paris, being an early bird can help you see and enjoy everything a little more. The whole cemetery is a complete experience and it takes a while to see it, I would recommend doing it in 2 different days so you can pay a visit to all those great poets, actors, writers and artists that made this world magnificent with their lives!
Plain grave of a famous song writer. A fence in the way.
Still beautiful but nowadays surrounded by fences... Can't go to the grave to put some flowers or other gifts for Jim. Put some incense sticks behind the fence...

The grave had no official marker until French officials placed a shield over it, which was stolen in 1973. In 1981, Croatian sculptor Mladen Mikulin voluntarily ‚Äì with the approval of the cemetery curators ‚Äì placed a marble bust of his own design and a new gravestone with Morrison's name at the grave to commemorate the tenth anniversary of Morrison's death; the bust was defaced through the years by vandals and later stolen in 1988.Mikulin made another bust of Morrison in 1989 and a bronze portrait ("death mask") of him in 2001; neither piece is at the gravesite. In 1990, Morrison's father, George Stephen Morrison, after a consultation with E. Nicholas Genovese, Professor of Classics and Humanities, San Diego State University, placed a flat stone on the grave. The bronze plaque thereon bears the Greek inscription: ŒöŒëŒ§Œë Œ§ŒüŒù ŒîŒëŒôŒúŒüŒùŒë ŒïŒëŒ•Œ§ŒüŒ•, usually translated as "true to his own spirit" or "according to his own daemon". This is all according to wikipedia.

Trip to Paris now complete... listened to "Riders On The Storm" while at the site... was really surprised how emotional the fans who are still coming here from all over the world were still grieving.. üòî ‚Ä¶

Grave is in second row somehow hidden and fenced with some of those iron barriers, which prevent you to hurt yourself when falling in one of those not really deep, but still significant holes dug up at road constructions, when some cables or pipes needs to be maintained, whatever. Still was happy to check on Jimmy. One star off considered because of all those other annoying fans, but in the end it's just a grave, RIP.
A bit strange. A very simple grave in a very crowded cemetery.  The whole place makes you think... I cannot understand the habit of sticking chewing gums to a nearby tree...
This grave yard is beautiful. Rothchild, Oscar wild and even Jim Morrison. It was sad how vandalized everything was around Jim's grave but what an experience to see it.

We visited the grave while wondering in the cemetery, on a nice and a bit cold Parisian winter weekend. The Cemetery is really nice and a major attraction, and I took this picture to send to a friend who'se also Doors fan. That friend is a professor who studied in UCLA, where - guess who?- Jim Morrison also studied! Morrison soon dropped out of university to pursue his musical career  üé∂üé∂
Amazing and sad. Happy i went and reflected on the Doors.
Its sad to see the state it is now, apparently there was a small statue of him on top and you were allowed to get closer , now just an old fence seperates the visitors that still come to see it.

So true story: I left my Airbnb to walk to JM grave. Pressed play on Doors 1st album as I left my home. Just ss I arrived (I mean stepped up and leaned on the fencing of his grave) at his resting place, the final song started... Titled? You guest it..."The End". The track btw is 00:11:43 long. Any one guess Jim Morrison's birth year? Nineteen 43!!! So I stood there and contemplated life for...00:11:43 of my life... Then I went to Oscar Wilde's tomb!

Grave Robbers; Shame On You! You've ruined his resting place for everyone else! His headstone is not there anymore and there are gates around his grave so you can't get close. Shame on those who have chipped away pieces of his resting area! Not that I know, but I don't think Jim would have wanted his headstone taken away, nor have his tomb be chipped away at by fans. Pictures and his music and words is what he left behind for everyone and his resting place is being desecrated. Shame on you all, you know who you are.
Big fan of Morrison, may he rest in peace. But the grave is almost hidden between giant graves and really hard to spot or find. It was also closed and the tombstone is really hard to read.

It was the greatest night of my life. Although I still had not found a wife I had my friends Right there beside me. We were close together. We tripped the wall and we scaled the graveyard Ancient shapes were all around us. The wet dew felt fresh beside the fog. Two made love in an ancient spot One chased a rabbit into the dark A girl got drunk and balled the dead And I gave empty sermons to my head. Cemetary, cool and quiet Hate to leave your sacred lay Dread the milky coming of the day.
